TranscriptPart 1

Part 2

Part 3

Part 4January 8, 9:46 AMDistrict CourtDefendant Lobby No. 1Byrde:
Gooood morning, Mr. Wright!Maya:
Good morning, Maggey!Byrde:
So, what do you think is going to happen today, sir? Yesterday's session didn't go so well, and then ended on a giant mystery.Phoenix:
(That's true... And we still haven't solved a single part of it yet...)Maya:
Are you OK, Nick?Phoenix:
Huh? Oh, uh... Yeah. Of course.Byrde:
I saw that! That little flash of doubt in your eyes!Phoenix:
N-No! That wasn't doubt. That was, umm... determination!Byrde:
Why don't I believe you...?Maya:
It's nearly time, Maggey. You'd better get going to the defendant's seat.Byrde:
Roger. Don't let me down, Mr. Wright. I'm counting on you!Hey, pal!Phoenix:
Hey, Detective Gumshoe...Gumshoe:
Quit stressing Maggey out! She doesn't need that!Phoenix:
H-How did you know she was stressed...?Gumshoe:
I was watching through the doorway.Phoenix:
Oh...Gumshoe:
You look like you lost the case already. Show a bit of confidence, will you, pal!? Here, maybe this'll help.Maya:
Huh!? Have you taken up aromatherapy, too?Gumshoe:
Not in a million years, pal! Don't tell me that you don't remember this thing?Phoenix:
(Hmm... Come to think of it, that doesn't look like one of those aromatherapy bottles...)Gumshoe:
This is the small bottle that turned up in Trés Bien's kitchen a couple of days ago.Maya:
Wow! Look at all these little bottles!Phoenix:
Oh! They're aromatherapy oils! He's got so many, they're overflowing onto the floor...Maya:
Hey, wait a minute... There's one bottle that's different from all the others.Phoenix:
Well what do you know. And it doesn't have a label either.Maya:
And... *sniff* It doesn't smell.Gumshoe:
We finally got the analysis results back from the lab.Maya:
So!? What is it? Is it the poison?Gumshoe:
I'm afraid not, pal. It's... medication.Maya:
Medication?Gumshoe:
Yeah. For ears. Topical use only, apparently.Phoenix:
For ears? You mean...?Gumshoe:
Yeah. It's the medication Glen Elg was using for his ruptured eardrum!Phoenix:
(What was Glen Elg's ear medicine doing in the kitchen...?)Small Bottle refiled into the Court Record.Phoenix:
Um, what about the unidentified fingerprints? Anything on that?Gumshoe:
Someone screwed up, so they only had time to analyze the contents of the bottle. Another hour and they might have gotten something on the prints, but...Phoenix:
(Hmm... That's going to weaken its impact as a piece of evidence...)Gumshoe:
OK, pal! This is it! Make sure your defense is impregnable today, got it!?Phoenix:
(Today's trial... I'm gonna expose that guy for what he's done, or my name isn't Phoenix Wright!)January 8, 10:00 AMDistrict CourtCourtroom No. 4Judge:
Court is now in session for the trial of Maggey Byrde.Phoenix:
The defense is ready, Your Honor.Godot:
Ready and waiting as always, Your Honor.Judge:
Very good. Then we'll get underway at once. Yesterday we heard the testimony of Mr. Victor Kudo. He claims to have witnessed the defendant putting a powder into the victim's coffee. However, the witness's testimony was plagued with a number of problems.Godot:
The mark on the rim of the cup shows that the victim drank from it with his right hand. But according to the old man's testimony, he picked it up with his left hand.Judge:
Thank you, Mr. Godot. Furthermore, according to the witness's account... ...the victim was listening to the radio with an earpiece in his left ear. Yet, the victim's left eardrum was ruptured, which made him effectively deaf in that ear.Maya:
It's amazing how many contradictions a single case can have, huh Nick?Godot:
Ha...! Allow me to enlighten you, Your Honor. The world, you see, keeps turning, and we must turn with it.Judge:
... You've lost me already, Mr. Godot.Godot:
Don't let the mysteries of yesterday mystify you today. Only losers think like that. You've got to change with the times! That's one of my rules!Judge:
Are you implying that you've resolved these contradictions? You know the answers to these riddles!?Godot:
The old guy wasn't just throwing seed in here. He was throwing us off the scent. And today I'll prove it.Judge:
Very well. Let the first witness take the stand!Godot:
And you are?Armstrong:
Oh bonjour, everyone! I am Jean Armstrong. z'e owner and 'ead chef of la Trés Bien restaurant. Enchanté!.........Judge:
Forgive me for asking, witness, but... are you a woman?Armstrong:
Oh là là, monsieur! As you can see, I am la pert and perky gentleman, non?Judge:
Er... Umm...Godot:
On the day of the incident, you were in Trés Bien's kitchen. Isn't that right?Armstrong:
W'iz you monsieur...Godot:
...?Armstrong:
...everything feels right!Godot:
Ha...!Phoenix:
(Wow, he's totally unfazed! Doesn't anything intimidate this guy...?)Judge:
Very well. Your testimony please, witness. Please tell the court what happened that day at Trés Bien.Armstrong:
Oui! Volontiers!Witness Testimony-- At Trés Bien --Armstrong:
When it all 'appened, z'ere were just two customers in my restaurant.
I remember I was experimenting w'iz some new art deco z'at day.
Like 'aving a large mirror between la tables, for example.
Oui! Per'aps z'at is what la old man was looking at.
La cup, la earpiece, and la glasses... 'E would 'ave seen everyz'ing in reverse, non?Phoenix:
A m...m...m... MIRROR!?Armstrong:
Oui! Un grand mirror! La most enormous mirror!Godot:
And suddenly, the mystery disappears! Like I said, the world keeps turning, so roll with it!Judge:
Hmm... That would explain the coffee cup and the earpiece conundrum... The mirror would have made everything appear back to front.Phoenix:
(What the heck!? It's way too early in the morning for this to be happening to me!)Judge:
Now then, Mr. Wright. You may begin your cross-examination.Cross Examination

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.

characters.name: Mia Fey
characters.description1: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.

characters.name: Godot
characters.description1: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Maggey Byrde
characters.description1: A waitress at Trés Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.

characters.name: Jean Armstrong
characters.description1: Trés Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
characters.description2: Trés Bien's owner and chef. Has a long debt and prior convictions for theft.

characters.name: Glen Elg
characters.description1: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
characters.description2: The victim. Was a programmer. His left eardrum was broken the day before the incident.
characters.description3: The victim. Was a programmer. Wore an HMD over left eye. Left eardrum was ruptured.

characters.name: Victor Kudo
characters.description1: Was in Trés Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
characters.description2: Was in Trés Bien at the time of the incident. Called the police by pay phone.

characters.name: Lisa Basil
characters.description1: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.

characters.name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
characters.description1: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
characters.description2: The granddaughter of crime boss Bruto Cadaverini. A thoroughly bitter person.

characters.name: Furio Tigre
characters.description1: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".

characters.name: Bruto Cadaverini
characters.description1: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.

evidence_objects.name: Attorney's Badge
evidence_objects.description1: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

evidence_objects.name: Maya's Magatama
evidence_objects.obtained: Received from Maya Fey.  → Found in the Kitchen.
evidence_objects.description1: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
evidence_objects.description2: On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Trés Bien.

evidence_objects.name: Magazine Clipping
evidence_objects.description1: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.

evidence_objects.name: Sports Paper
evidence_objects.description1: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. Click here for details.
evidence_objects.description2: Left by a costumer in Trés Bien on Dec. 3rd. Click here for details.
evidence_objects.description3: Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Job Listings
evidence_objects.description1: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.

evidence_objects.name: Lunch Special
evidence_objects.description1: Trés Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.

evidence_objects.name: Small Bottle
evidence_objects.description1: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown.
evidence_objects.description2: The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen.
evidence_objects.description3: The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.

evidence_objects.name: Scooter
evidence_objects.description1: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.

evidence_objects.name: Jean's Loan Contract
evidence_objects.description1: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.

evidence_objects.name: Victor's Note
evidence_objects.description1: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"

evidence_objects.name: Glen's Autopsy Report
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Detective Gumshoe.
evidence_objects.description1: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.

evidence_objects.name: Trés Bien Floor Plans
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Detective Gumshoe.
evidence_objects.description1: Blueprints of the crime scene. Click here for details. X = victim's seat.

evidence_objects.name: Crime Photo
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Detective Gumshoe.
evidence_objects.description1: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Coffee Cup
evidence_objects.description1: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.

evidence_objects.name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
evidence_objects.description1: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.

evidence_objects.name: Apron
evidence_objects.description1: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.

evidence_objects.name: Potassium Cyanide
evidence_objects.description1: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.

evidence_objects.name: Victim's Prescription Bag
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence during the trial.
evidence_objects.description1: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Trés Bien. The bag is empty.

evidence_objects.name: Victor's Testimony
evidence_objects.description1: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

evidence_objects.name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
evidence_objects.description1: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!

evidence_objects.name: Glen's Calendar
evidence_objects.description1: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".

evidence_objects.name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
evidence_objects.description1: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!

evidence_objects.name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
evidence_objects.description1: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.

evidence_objects.name: MC Bomber
evidence_objects.description1: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker.
evidence_objects.description2: Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program.
evidence_objects.description3: A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.

evidence_objects.name: Trés Bien Matches
evidence_objects.description1: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.

evidence_objects.name: Repair Bill
evidence_objects.description1: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.

evidence_objects.name: Paper Badge
evidence_objects.description1: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.

evidence_objects.name: Viola's Medical Papers
evidence_objects.description1: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

TranscriptPart 1

Part 2

Part 4January 8, 9:46 AMDistrict CourtDefendant Lobby No. 1Byrde:
Gooood morning, Mr. Wright!Maya:
Good morning, Maggey!Byrde:
So, what do you think is going to happen today, sir? Yesterday's session didn't go so well, and then ended on a giant mystery.Phoenix:
(That's true... And we still haven't solved a single part of it yet...)Maya:
Are you OK, Nick?Phoenix:
Huh? Oh, uh... Yeah. Of course.Byrde:
I saw that! That little flash of doubt in your eyes!Phoenix:
N-No! That wasn't doubt. That was, umm... determination!Byrde:
Why don't I believe you...?Maya:
It's nearly time, Maggey. You'd better get going to the defendant's seat.Byrde:
Roger. Don't let me down, Mr. Wright. I'm counting on you!Hey, pal!Phoenix:
Hey, Detective Gumshoe...Gumshoe:
Quit stressing Maggey out! She doesn't need that!Phoenix:
H-How did you know she was stressed...?Gumshoe:
I was watching through the doorway.Phoenix:
Oh...Gumshoe:
You look like you lost the case already. Show a bit of confidence, will you, pal!? Here, maybe this'll help.Maya:
Huh!? Have you taken up aromatherapy, too?Gumshoe:
Not in a million years, pal! Don't tell me that you don't remember this thing?Phoenix:
(Hmm... Come to think of it, that doesn't look like one of those aromatherapy bottles...)Gumshoe:
This is the small bottle that turned up in Trés Bien's kitchen a couple of days ago.Maya:
Wow! Look at all these little bottles!Phoenix:
Oh! They're aromatherapy oils! He's got so many, they're overflowing onto the floor...Maya:
Hey, wait a minute... There's one bottle that's different from all the others.Phoenix:
Well what do you know. And it doesn't have a label either.Maya:
And... *sniff* It doesn't smell.Gumshoe:
We finally got the analysis results back from the lab.Maya:
So!? What is it? Is it the poison?Gumshoe:
I'm afraid not, pal. It's... medication.Maya:
Medication?Gumshoe:
Yeah. For ears. Topical use only, apparently.Phoenix:
For ears? You mean...?Gumshoe:
Yeah. It's the medication Glen Elg was using for his ruptured eardrum!Phoenix:
(What was Glen Elg's ear medicine doing in the kitchen...?)Small Bottle refiled into the Court Record.Phoenix:
Um, what about the unidentified fingerprints? Anything on that?Gumshoe:
Someone screwed up, so they only had time to analyze the contents of the bottle. Another hour and they might have gotten something on the prints, but...Phoenix:
(Hmm... That's going to weaken its impact as a piece of evidence...)Gumshoe:
OK, pal! This is it! Make sure your defense is impregnable today, got it!?Phoenix:
(Today's trial... I'm gonna expose that guy for what he's done, or my name isn't Phoenix Wright!)January 8, 10:00 AMDistrict CourtCourtroom No. 4Judge:
Court is now in session for the trial of Maggey Byrde.Phoenix:
The defense is ready, Your Honor.Godot:
Ready and waiting as always, Your Honor.Judge:
Very good. Then we'll get underway at once. Yesterday we heard the testimony of Mr. Victor Kudo. He claims to have witnessed the defendant putting a powder into the victim's coffee. However, the witness's testimony was plagued with a number of problems.Godot:
The mark on the rim of the cup shows that the victim drank from it with his right hand. But according to the old man's testimony, he picked it up with his left hand.Judge:
Thank you, Mr. Godot. Furthermore, according to the witness's account... ...the victim was listening to the radio with an earpiece in his left ear. Yet, the victim's left eardrum was ruptured, which made him effectively deaf in that ear.Maya:
It's amazing how many contradictions a single case can have, huh Nick?Godot:
Ha...! Allow me to enlighten you, Your Honor. The world, you see, keeps turning, and we must turn with it.Judge:
... You've lost me already, Mr. Godot.Godot:
Don't let the mysteries of yesterday mystify you today. Only losers think like that. You've got to change with the times! That's one of my rules!Judge:
Are you implying that you've resolved these contradictions? You know the answers to these riddles!?Godot:
The old guy wasn't just throwing seed in here. He was throwing us off the scent. And today I'll prove it.Judge:
Very well. Let the first witness take the stand!Godot:
And you are?Armstrong:
Oh bonjour, everyone! I am Jean Armstrong. z'e owner and 'ead chef of la Trés Bien restaurant. Enchanté!.........Judge:
Forgive me for asking, witness, but... are you a woman?Armstrong:
Oh là là, monsieur! As you can see, I am la pert and perky gentleman, non?Judge:
Er... Umm...Godot:
On the day of the incident, you were in Trés Bien's kitchen. Isn't that right?Armstrong:
W'iz you monsieur...Godot:
...?Armstrong:

evidence_objects.description1: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.

evidence_objects.name: Potassium Cyanide
evidence_objects.description1: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.

evidence_objects.name: Victim's Prescription Bag
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence during the trial.
evidence_objects.description1: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Trés Bien. The bag is empty.

evidence_objects.name: Victor's Testimony
evidence_objects.description1: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."

evidence_objects.name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
evidence_objects.description1: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!

evidence_objects.name: Glen's Calendar
evidence_objects.description1: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".

evidence_objects.name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
evidence_objects.description1: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!

evidence_objects.name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
evidence_objects.description1: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.

evidence_objects.name: MC Bomber
evidence_objects.description1: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker.
evidence_objects.description2: Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program.
evidence_objects.description3: A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.

evidence_objects.name: Trés Bien Matches
evidence_objects.description1: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.

evidence_objects.name: Repair Bill
evidence_objects.description1: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.

evidence_objects.name: Paper Badge
evidence_objects.description1: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.

evidence_objects.name: Viola's Medical Papers
evidence_objects.description1: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Huh? Oh, uh... Yeah. Of course.Byrde:

Roger. Don't let me down, Mr. Wright. I'm counting on you!Hey, pal!Phoenix:
Hey, Detective Gumshoe...Gumshoe:
Quit stressing Maggey out! She doesn't need that!Phoenix:
H-How did you know she was stressed...?Gumshoe:
I was watching through the doorway.Phoenix:
Oh...Gumshoe:
You look like you lost the case already. Show a bit of confidence, will you, pal!? Here, maybe this'll help.Maya:
Huh!? Have you taken up aromatherapy, too?Gumshoe:
Not in a million years, pal! Don't tell me that you don't remember this thing?Phoenix:

Oh! They're aromatherapy oils! He's got so many, they're overflowing onto the floor...Maya:
Hey, wait a minute... There's one bottle that's different from all the others.Phoenix:
Well what do you know. And it doesn't have a label either.Maya:
And... *sniff* It doesn't smell.Gumshoe:

I'm afraid not, pal. It's... medication.Maya:
Medication?Gumshoe:

... You've lost me already, Mr. Godot.Godot:

And you are?Armstrong:

W'iz you monsieur...Godot:
...?Armstrong:

Ha...!Phoenix:
